product_name: L'OrealInfallible Blur-Fection Longwear Loose Setting Powder
summary: SummaryL'Oreal's Infallible Blur-Fection Longwear Loose Setting Powder blurs, brightens, and sets makeup for all-day wear. Perfect for highlighting and a brighter complexion.
details: DetailsFeaturesInfallible up to 24H Blur-fection Longwear Loose Setting Powder sets your makeup while blurring and brighteningLightweight powders with longwear effects. Transfer resistant, flashback resistant, talc-free. Up to 24 hour wearAiry loose setting powder that blurs the appearance of fine lines and pores while locking in makeup for up to 24H. Pink-tinted shades to brighten and subtly color correct and translucent shades to beautifully blurTo set makeup, press powder into freshly applied foundation or concealer with a powder puff, beauty sponge, or brush. After waiting for a few minutes, lightly dust off remaining powder for a soft matte lookAvailable in four shades. Suitable for all skin types and sensitive skinItem 2640905How To UseTilt the powder case and lightly tap to cause powder to fall into the lid.Using a puff, beauty sponge, or brush, press the powder into the face, specifically the T Zone, undereyes, outer corners of the mouth, and chin.Let the product bake for a few minutes before using a brush to lightly dust off excess powder.Enjoy up to 24 hours of blurring and brighteningIngredientsZea Mays Starch / Corn Starch, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Cellulose, Lauroyl Lysine, Copernicia Cerifera Cera / Carnauba Wax / Cire De Carnauba, Squalane, Tocopherol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Hydrogen Dimethicone, Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil / Sunflower Seed Oil. May Contain: CI 77163 / Bismuth Oxychloride, CI 19140 / Yellow 5 Lake, CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499 / Iron Oxides, CI 73360 / Red 30, CI 77007 / Ultramarines. (F.I.L. N70037364/1).
how_to_use: Tilt the powder case and lightly tap to cause powder to fall into the lid.Using a puff, beauty sponge, or brush, press the powder into the face, specifically the T Zone, undereyes, outer corners of the mouth, and chin.Let the product bake for a few minutes before using a brush to lightly dust off excess powder.Enjoy up to 24 hours of blurring and brightening
ingredients: Copernicia Cerifera Cera / Carnauba Wax / Cire De Carnauba
Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil / Sunflower Seed Oil. May Contain:

reviews.headline: I love this!!
reviews.comments: Love the blurring effect this setting powder has… I use a little under my eyes, cheeks, and forehead and it's perfect.

reviews.headline: Buy again!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love L'Oréal makeup products and this one is another winner! It holds my liquid foundation in place and does not make my makeup looked caked on!!

reviews.headline: Fresh All-Day Glow on Melanin Skin
reviews.comments: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. The L'Oréal Deep Pink Infallible Blur-fection Loose Powder is really nice. It's super light, sets my makeup without feeling heavy, and actually does last all day. On my melanin skin tone, the pink shade gives me a cool, fresh look and blends so well with blush. Definitely one of those powders that just pulls everything together.

reviews.headline: I really blurs
reviews.comments: I saw it on Tick Toc so I decided to buy it, great product, it really blurs your skin. Highly recommended

reviews.headline: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The pink loose powder blurs under eye lines partnered with some concealer. I really liked the pink tint especially with my skin tone. The product t actually felt like a high end brand!

reviews.headline: Subtle and pretty!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I'm pleasantly surprised by this product! My skin tone is naturally rosy so I worried about the pink tint but it really just smooths out my skin tone. I love how it sets my tinted moisturizer, so I don't get shiny throughout the day!

reviews.headline: New favorite!
reviews.comments: The new L'Oréal Pink Loose Setting Powder is so good! It's super lightweight, brightens my under-eyes instantly, and keeps everything smooth without looking cakey. Definitely gives that soft, filtered finish.

reviews.headline: Lightweight Powder
reviews.comments: Overall, great lightweight setting powder, especially if you have combination skin and want to set your face without drying it out. No harsh smells and lasts for a while! Still made my skin feel and look dewy and not cakey.  It did not make my acne breakout. Id buy again!

reviews.headline: Nice but not very blurring
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love the way this powder feels on my skin! And I do think it is a nice powder and works well. My only thing is I don't think it's quite blurring enough to be called blur-fection. It just seems like a typical nice powder.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I love this product so much! It works great at setting my under eye and has such a pretty pinky color. The scent is great and is full coverage, I love the packaging and texture of the powder.

reviews.headline: So pretty and light!
reviews.comments: This is such a beautiful powder. I use it under my eyes. It's so light, but makes my under eyes look flawless. I have never used a pink powder before, but I love this one! I'd love to try it in other colors as well. [I received this product in exchange for my honest review]

reviews.headline: Brightening and Blurring Perfection
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This setting powder has quickly become one of my new favorites. I was worried it would look ashy and wouldn't blend well on dark skin but it does the opposite. The soft pink tone gives such a beautiful brightening effect without looking chalky, and it really smooths out my skin for that blurred, airbrushed finish. It definitely provides a matte finish and smoothing effect. I've worn it on long days and it holds up so well, even in heat and humidity. No flashback in photos either, which is a huge win. It feels lightweight but still makes a big difference in how polished my makeup looks. I'll definitely keep this in my routine!

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I've always wanted to try pink setting powder! So I was very exited to try this one, Perfect for my medium tone skin. I love that it do not have a scent. Packaging is a little messy, like almost all loosing powders. 
I love the finish look, not very matte. 
Good for Avery day powder.

reviews.headline: Great powder option
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I loved using this L'Oreal Paris pink blur powder! It reminds me of a more expensive one but does the same job. It has great coverage and easy to use. Love the color

reviews.headline: Great on mature skin
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] What a great link powder for my nature skin. Doesn't cake quick or cause too much creasing at all. I really love the packaging it comes in too! It's less messy that so many I have! Definitely going to be rebuying this!

reviews.headline: Blurring and easy to use
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This powder works great! It sets quickly and blends in smoothly with my other makeup. The blurring effect is nice and minimal but I also don't wear a ton of the powder, just enough to take an edge off of the shine on my forehead and undereye areas. One improvement could be adding a travel poof to the packaging, if you don't have a brush or poof already to apply the powder then you have to buy one to be able to use this product.

reviews.headline: Durability and affordable
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I like that it is easy to apply and doesn't wash me out or feel cakey like other powders. I think it would be better with a pressing pad or if it came with a little brush for application

reviews.headline: Great coverage
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The packaging is simple and was easy to use. The coverage was nice and the pink tone blended well with my undertones. The finish was nice and this didn't feel too caked on the skin.

reviews.headline: Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I was very pleasantly surprised using this powder. I usually go for a yellow color (banana shade), but this was absolutely beautiful on my skin. It made me look very glowy without a flashback when taking pictures, and  it blurred my skin like a filter!  The only thing I didn't love was the packaging. It's very basic and not the easiest to get the product out. Other than that, I love it, and I would repurchase!

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again
reviews.comments: I love how flawless it looks, as if I had a filter on. Totally recommended!

media.headline: Best L'oreal Paris Loose Setting Powder Ever!
media.caption: Check this out!

faceoff_positive.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I really wanted to try the Blur-Fection setting powder from Loreal Paris as I've heard really good things about it from numerous sources. So when I received it from free in exchange for my honest opinion, I was very excited. I do have a favorite setting powder of mine from another brand, so I didn't really look for a new one but this one caught my attention. The packaging is compact and slim, not any different from majority of loose setting powders from other brands, which is great if you wanna carry it in your purse. However, since it doesn't come with any applicator, you need a brush or a makeup sponge on hand if you do your makeup outside your home. I mostly do it at home, so it's not a big issue for me. It's not heavily scented, which is a huge plus for me. Overall, it sits pretty well on my tinted moisturizer and doesn't cake. I don't apply setting powder in the creases though, like under eyes for example, to avoid the caking effect, so the powder really works for my skin. Glad I got to try it as it's definitely something I will purchase in the future, especially considering it's about double or even triple cheaper than the brand I've been using for a while.
faceoff_positive.headline: My new staple in makeup routine

faceoff_negative.comments: I don't know where the good reviews are coming from but this powder SUCKS. I got the translucent and the light pink one thing I noticed upon application was my forhead had a shiny patch so I decided to test the powder on my palm and in fact it has a shiny pearl like finish to it which.. ew. It didn't last 5min and my skin was sooo shiny. It did NOTHING for my oils. It excentuated pores due to the pearl like finish also I feel like it is too fine to even set tou have to use half the dang thing in one go and for the price you don't get alot of product and speaking of product the pores it comes out of are so terrible I have to slam it to get product out and so little powder comes out at a time. If you're going for shiny no makeup makeup and you have normal to dry skin this is for you.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not for oily girls

rollup.name: Infallible Blur-Fection Longwear Loose Setting Powder
